Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First, let me list all the activities involved again to make sure I don't miss any...

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The process flow for an order might be something like: RO  CA  RI  PI  QC  PO  GSL  D  IC  RP...

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First, **Equivalence**: Looking for activities that must have the same occurrence count...

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: CA: can occur 0 or 1. So allowed counts {0,1}... RI: 0 or 1. PI: 0 or 1. And so on.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Directly-Follows Constraints: As outlined earlier, the consecutive pairs are...

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Equivalence pairs could be: - RO and GSL must both be present once. - QC and PO must both be present...

Name: Validation - PE
Text: But in the case where CA occurs but RI doesn't (e.g., items not available), then CA would be 1 and RI 0...

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Alternatively, perhaps 'always_after' means... But since CA must come after RO anyway, this is already covered...

Name: Ethical or Moral Reasoning - IND
Text: RO: Can we assume it always exists as the first activity? It seems reasonable given the scenario outline.
